Solarwinds Orion (with Web Console WPM 2019.4.1, and Orion Platform
HF4 or NPM HF2 2019.4) allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary
code via a defined event.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14009
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://www.proofpoint.com/us/security/security-advisories

Proofpoint Enterprise Protection (PPS/PoD) before 8.16.4 contains a
vulnerability that could allow an attacker to deliver an email message
with a malicious attachment that bypasses scanning and file-blocking
rules. The vulnerability exists because messages with certain crafted
and malformed multipart structures are not properly handled.

Status: Candidate

Reference: MISC:https://knassar702.github.io/cve/xenon/

The Laborator Xenon theme 1.3 for WordPress allows Reflected XSS via
the data/typeahead-generate.php q (aka name) parameter.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14011
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/158205/Lansweeper-7.2-Default-Account-Remote-Code-Execution.html
Reference: MISC:https://pastebin.com/EUkMx94X
Reference: MISC:https://www.lansweeper.com/knowledgebase/restricting-access-to-the-web-console/

Lansweeper 6.0.x through 7.2.x has a default installation in which the
admin password is configured for the admin account, unless "Built-in
admin" is manually unchecked. This allows command execution via the
Add New Package and Scheduled Deployments features.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14012
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/osTicket/osTicket/issues/5514

scp/categories.php in osTicket 1.14.2 allows XSS via a Knowledgebase
Category Name or Category Description. The attacker must be an Agent.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14013
Status: Candidate

** RESERVED ** This candidate has been reserved by an organization or
individual that will use it when announcing a new security problem.
When the candidate has been publicized, the details for this candidate
will be provided.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14014
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://blog.sean-wright.com/navigate-cms/
Reference: MISC:https://cxsecurity.com/issue/WLB-2018090182

An issue was discovered in Navigate CMS 2.8 and 2.9 r1433. The query
parameter fid on the resource navigate.php does not perform sufficient
data validation and/or encoding, making it vulnerable to reflected
XSS.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14015
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://blog.sean-wright.com/navigate-cms/

An issue was discovered in Navigate CMS 2.9 r1433. When performing a
password reset, a user is emailed an activation code that allows them
to reset their password. There is, however, a flaw when no activation
code is supplied. The system will allow an unauthorized user to
continue setting a password, even though no activation code was
supplied, setting the password for the most recently created user in
the system (the user with the highest user id).

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14016
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://blog.sean-wright.com/navigate-cms/

An issue was discovered in Navigate CMS 2.9 r1433. The forgot-password
feature allows users to reset their passwords by using either their
username or the email address associated with their account. However,
the feature returns a not_found message when the provided username or
email address does not match a user in the system. This can be used to
enumerate users.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14017
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://blog.sean-wright.com/navigate-cms/

An issue was discovered in Navigate CMS 2.9 r1433. Sessions, as well
as associated information such as CSRF tokens, are stored in cleartext
files in the directory /private/sessions. An unauthenticated user
could use a brute-force approach to attempt to identify existing
sessions, or view the contents of this file to discover details about
a session.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14018
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://blog.sean-wright.com/navigate-cms/

An issue was discovered in Navigate CMS 2.9 r1433. There is a stored
XSS vulnerability that is executed on the page to view users, and on
the page to edit users. This is present in both the User field and the
E-Mail field. On the Edit user page, the XSS is only triggered via the
E-Mail field; however, on the View user page the XSS is triggered via
either the User field or the E-Mail field.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14019
Status: Candidate
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2020-46ec9e748b
Reference: URL:https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/TNMCV2DJJTX345YYBXAMJBXNNVUZQ5UH/
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/open-iscsi/rtslib-fb/pull/162
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2020:1156
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-08/msg00012.html

Open-iSCSI rtslib-fb through 2.1.72 has weak permissions for
/etc/target/saveconfig.json because shutil.copyfile (instead of
shutil.copy) is used, and thus permissions are not preserved.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-1402
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2020-1402
Reference: URL:https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2020-1402

An elevation of privilege vulnerability exists when the Windows
ActiveX Installer Service improperly handles memory.To exploit this
vulnerability, an attacker would first have to gain execution on the
victim system, aka 'Windows ActiveX Installer Service Elevation of
Privilege Vulnerability'.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14020
Status: Candidate

** RESERVED ** This candidate has been reserved by an organization or
individual that will use it when announcing a new security problem.
When the candidate has been publicized, the details for this candidate
will be provided.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14021
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/DrunkenShells/Disclosures/tree/master/CVE-2020-14021-Arbitrary%20File%20Read-Ozeki%20SMS%20Gateway
Reference: MISC:https://www.ozeki.hu/index.php?ow_page_number=1017&downloadaction=email&download_product_id=1&os=windows&dpath=%2Fattachments%2F702%2Finstallwindows_1590575794_OzekiNG-SMS-Gateway_4.17.6.zip&dname=Ozeki+NG+SMS+Gateway+v4.17.6&dsize=+%2817.8+MB%29&platform=Windows
Reference: MISC:https://www.ozeki.hu/index.php?owpn=231

An issue was discovered in Ozeki NG SMS Gateway through 4.17.6. The
ASP.net SMS module can be used to read and validate the source code of
ASP files. By altering the path, it can be made to read any file on
the Operating System, usually with NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM privileges.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14022
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/DrunkenShells/Disclosures/tree/master/CVE-2020-14022-Dangerous%20File%20Upload-Ozeki%20SMS%20Gateway
Reference: MISC:https://www.ozeki.hu/index.php?ow_page_number=1017&downloadaction=email&download_product_id=1&os=windows&dpath=%2Fattachments%2F702%2Finstallwindows_1590575794_OzekiNG-SMS-Gateway_4.17.6.zip&dname=Ozeki+NG+SMS+Gateway+v4.17.6&dsize=+%2817.8+MB%29&platform=Windows
Reference: MISC:https://www.ozeki.hu/index.php?owpn=231

Ozeki NG SMS Gateway 4.17.1 through 4.17.6 does not check the file
type when bulk importing new contacts ("Import Contacts"
functionality) from a file. It is possible to upload an executable or
.bat file that can be executed with the help of a functionality (E.g.
the "Application Starter" module) within the application.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14023
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/DrunkenShells/Disclosures/tree/master/CVE-2020-14023-Server%20Side%20Request%20Forgery-Ozeki%20SMS%20Gateway
Reference: MISC:https://www.ozeki.hu/index.php?owpn=231

Ozeki NG SMS Gateway through 4.17.6 allows SSRF via SMS WCF or RSS To
SMS.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14024
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/DrunkenShells/Disclosures/tree/master/CVE-2020-14024-Multiple%20XSS-Ozeki%20SMS%20Gateway
Reference: MISC:https://www.ozeki.hu/index.php?owpn=231

Ozeki NG SMS Gateway through 4.17.6 has multiple authenticated stored
and/or reflected XSS vulnerabilities via the (1) Receiver or Recipient
field in the Mailbox feature, (2) OZFORM_GROUPNAME field in the Group
configuration of addresses, (3) listname field in the Defining address
lists configuration, or (4) any GET Parameter in the /default URL of
the application.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14025
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/DrunkenShells/Disclosures/tree/master/CVE-2020-14025-Cross-Site%20Request%20Forgery-Ozeki%20SMS%20Gateway
Reference: MISC:https://www.ozeki.hu/index.php?owpn=231

Ozeki NG SMS Gateway through 4.17.6 has multiple CSRF vulnerabilities.
For example, an administrator, by following a link, can be tricked
into making unwanted changes such as installing new modules or
changing a password.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14026
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/DrunkenShells/Disclosures/tree/master/CVE-2020-14026-Formula%20Injection-Ozeki%20SMS%20Gateway
Reference: MISC:https://www.ozeki.hu/index.php?ow_page_number=1017&downloadaction=email&download_product_id=1&os=windows&dpath=%2Fattachments%2F702%2Finstallwindows_1590575794_OzekiNG-SMS-Gateway_4.17.6.zip&dname=Ozeki+NG+SMS+Gateway+v4.17.6&dsize=+%2817.8+MB%29&platform=Windows
Reference: MISC:https://www.ozeki.hu/index.php?owpn=231

CSV Injection (aka Excel Macro Injection or Formula Injection) exists
in the Export Of Contacts feature in Ozeki NG SMS Gateway through
4.17.6 via a value that is mishandled in a CSV export.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14027
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:http://www.ozeki.hu/index.php?owpn=231
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/DrunkenShells/Disclosures/tree/master/CVE-2020-14027-MySQL%20LOAD%20DATA%20LOCAL%20INFILE%20Attack-Ozeki%20SMS%20Gateway

An issue was discovered in Ozeki NG SMS Gateway through 4.17.6. The
database connection strings accept custom unsafe arguments, such as
ENABLE_LOCAL_INFILE, that can be leveraged by attackers to enable
MySQL Load Data Local (rogue MySQL server) attacks.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14028
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:http://www.ozeki.hu/index.php?owpn=231
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/DrunkenShells/Disclosures/tree/master/CVE-2020-14028-Arbitary%20File%20Write-Ozeki%20SMS%20Gateway

An issue was discovered in Ozeki NG SMS Gateway through 4.17.6. By
leveraging a path traversal vulnerability in the Autoreply module's
Script Name, an attacker may write to or overwrite arbitrary files,
with arbitrary content, usually with NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM privileges.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14029
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:http://www.ozeki.hu/index.php?owpn=231
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/DrunkenShells/Disclosures/tree/master/CVE-2020-14029-XXE-Ozeki%20SMS%20Gateway

An issue was discovered in Ozeki NG SMS Gateway through 4.17.6. The
RSS To SMS module processes XML files in an unsafe manner. This opens
the application to an XML External Entity attack that can be used to
perform SSRF or read arbitrary local files.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-1403
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2020-1403
Reference: URL:https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2020-1403

A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that the
VBScript engine handles objects in memory, aka 'VBScript Remote Code
Execution Vulnerability'.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14030
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:http://www.ozeki.hu/index.php?owpn=231
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/DrunkenShells/Disclosures/tree/master/CVE-2020-14030-RCE%20via%20.NET%20Deserialization-Ozeki%20SMS%20Gateway

An issue was discovered in Ozeki NG SMS Gateway through 4.17.6. It
stores SMS messages in .NET serialized format on the filesystem. By
generating (and writing to the disk) malicious .NET serialized files,
an attacker can trick the product into deserializing them, resulting
in arbitrary code execution.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14031
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:http://www.ozeki.hu/index.php?owpn=231
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/DrunkenShells/Disclosures/tree/master/CVE-2020-14031-Arbitary%20File%20Delete-Ozeki%20SMS%20Gateway

An issue was discovered in Ozeki NG SMS Gateway through 4.17.6. The
outbox functionality of the TXT File module can be used to delete
all/most files in a folder. Because the product usually runs as NT
AUTHORITY\SYSTEM, the only files that will not be deleted are those
currently being run by the system and/or files that have special
security attributes (e.g., Windows Defender files).

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14032
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://dannyodler.medium.com/attacking-the-golden-ring-on-amd-mini-pc-b7bfb217b437
Reference: MISC:https://www.asrock.com/support/index.us.asp?cat=BIOS

ASRock 4x4 BOX-R1000 before BIOS P1.40 allows privilege escalation via
code execution in the SMM.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14033
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/meetecho/janus-gateway/pull/2229
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/meetecho/janus-gateway/blob/v0.10.0/plugins/janus_streaming.c#L6117
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/meetecho/janus-gateway/blob/v0.10.0/plugins/janus_streaming.c#L6166

An issue was discovered in janus-gateway (aka Janus WebRTC Server)
through 0.10.0. janus_streaming_rtsp_parse_sdp in
plugins/janus_streaming.c has a Buffer Overflow via a crafted RTSP
server.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14034
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/meetecho/janus-gateway/pull/2229
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/meetecho/janus-gateway/blob/v0.10.0/utils.c#L381
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/meetecho/janus-gateway/blob/v0.10.0/utils.c#L401

An issue was discovered in janus-gateway (aka Janus WebRTC Server)
through 0.10.0. janus_get_codec_from_pt in utils.c has a Buffer
Overflow via long value in an SDP Offer packet.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14039
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/golang-announce/XZNfaiwgt2w
Reference: URL:https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/golang-announce/XZNfaiwgt2w
Reference: CONFIRM:https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200731-0005/
Reference: URL:https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200731-0005/
Reference: MISC:https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/golang-announce
Reference: URL:https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/golang-announce
Reference: MISC:https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuApr2021.html
Reference: URL:https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuApr2021.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2020:1087
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-07/msg00077.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2020:1095
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-07/msg00082.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2020:1405
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-09/msg00029.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2020:1407
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-09/msg00030.html

In Go before 1.13.13 and 1.14.x before 1.14.5, Certificate.Verify may
lack a check on the VerifyOptions.KeyUsages EKU requirements (if
VerifyOptions.Roots equals nil and the installation is on Windows).
Thus, X.509 certificate verification is incomplete.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-1404
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2020-1404
Reference: URL:https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2020-1404

An elevation of privilege vulnerability exists when the Windows
Runtime improperly handles objects in memory, aka 'Windows Runtime
Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability'. This CVE ID is unique from
CVE-2020-1249, CVE-2020-1353, CVE-2020-1370, CVE-2020-1399,
CVE-2020-1413, CVE-2020-1414, CVE-2020-1415, CVE-2020-1422.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14040
Status: Candidate
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2020-a55f130272
Reference: URL:https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/TACQFZDPA7AUR6TRZBCX2RGRFSDYLI7O/
Reference: MISC:https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/golang-announce/bXVeAmGOqz0

The x/text package before 0.3.3 for Go has a vulnerability in
encoding/unicode that could lead to the UTF-16 decoder entering an
infinite loop, causing the program to crash or run out of memory. An
attacker could provide a single byte to a UTF16 decoder instantiated
with UseBOM or ExpectBOM to trigger an infinite loop if the String
function on the Decoder is called, or the Decoder is passed to
golang.org/x/text/transform.String.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14042
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://advisory.checkmarx.net/advisory/CX-2020-4278
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/Codiad/Codiad/blob/master/README.md
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/Codiad/Codiad/issues/1122

** PRODUCT NOT SUPPORTED WHEN ASSIGNED ** A Cross Site Scripting (XSS)
vulnerability was found in Codiad v1.7.8 and later. The vulnerability
occurs because of improper sanitization of the folder's name $path
variable in components/filemanager/class.filemanager.php. NOTE: the
vendor states "Codiad is no longer under active maintenance by core
contributors."

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14043
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://advisory.checkmarx.net/advisory/CX-2020-4279
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/Codiad/Codiad/blob/master/README.md
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/Codiad/Codiad/issues/1122

** PRODUCT NOT SUPPORTED WHEN ASSIGNED ** A Cross Side Request Forgery
(CSRF) vulnerability was found in Codiad v1.7.8 and later. The request
to download a plugin from the marketplace is only available to admin
users and it isn't CSRF protected in components/market/controller.php.
This might cause admins to make a vulnerable request without them
knowing and result in remote code execution. NOTE: the vendor states
"Codiad is no longer under active maintenance by core contributors."

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14044
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://advisory.checkmarx.net/advisory/CX-2020-4280
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/Codiad/Codiad/blob/master/README.md
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/Codiad/Codiad/issues/1122

** PRODUCT NOT SUPPORTED WHEN ASSIGNED ** A Server-Side Request
Forgery (SSRF) vulnerability was found in Codiad v1.7.8 and later. A
user with admin privileges could use the plugin install feature to
make the server request any URL via
components/market/class.market.php. This could potentially result in
remote code execution. NOTE: the vendor states "Codiad is no longer
under active maintenance by core contributors."

Name: CVE-2020-14049
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://jeffs.sh/CVEs/CVE-2020-14049.txt
Reference: MISC:https://www.viber.com/en/security/

Viber for Windows up to 13.2.0.39 does not properly quote its custom
URI handler. A malicious website could launch Viber with arbitrary
parameters, forcing a victim to send an NTLM authentication request,
and either relay the request or capture the hash for offline password
cracking. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for
CVE-2019-12569.

Name: CVE-2020-14055
Status: Candidate

encoding.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14056
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/sbaresearch/advisories/tree/public/2019/SBA-ADV-20191203-02_Monsta_FTP_Server-Side_Request_Forgery
Reference: MISC:https://www.monstaftp.com/notes/

Monsta FTP 2.10.1 or below is prone to a server-side request forgery
vulnerability due to insufficient restriction of the web fetch
functionality. This allows attackers to read arbitrary local files and
interact with arbitrary third-party services.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14057
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/sbaresearch/advisories/tree/public/2019/SBA-ADV-20191203-01_Monsta_FTP_Arbitrary_File_Read_and_Write
Reference: MISC:https://www.monstaftp.com/notes/

Monsta FTP 2.10.1 or below allows external control of paths used in
filesystem operations. This allows attackers to read and write
arbitrary local files, allowing an attacker to gain remote code
execution in common deployments.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14058
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.squid-cache.org/Advisories/SQUID-2020_6.txt
Reference: CONFIRM:https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210312-0001/
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2020-cbebc5617e
Reference: URL:https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/3RG5FGSTCAYVIJPJHIY3MRZ7NFT6HDO7/
Reference: MISC:http://www.squid-cache.org/Versions/v4/changesets/squid-4-93f5fda134a2a010b84ffedbe833d670e63ba4be.patch
Reference: MISC:http://www.squid-cache.org/Versions/v5/changesets/squid-5-c6d1a4f6a2cbebceebc8a3fcd8f539ceb7b7f723.patch

An issue was discovered in Squid before 4.12 and 5.x before 5.0.3. Due
to use of a potentially dangerous function, Squid and the default
certificate validation helper are vulnerable to a Denial of Service
when opening a TLS connection to an attacker-controlled server for
HTTPS. This occurs because unrecognized error values are mapped to
NULL, but later code expects that each error value is mapped to a
valid error string.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14059
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:http://www.squid-cache.org/Advisories/SQUID-2020_5.txt
Reference: CONFIRM:https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210312-0001/
Reference: MISC:http://www.squid-cache.org/Versions/v5/changesets/squid-5-7a5af8db8e0377c06ed9ffbdcb1334389c7cd8ab.patch

An issue was discovered in Squid 5.x before 5.0.3. Due to an Incorrect
Synchronization, a Denial of Service can occur when processing objects
in an SMP cache because of an Ipc::Mem::PageStack::pop ABA problem
during access to the memory page/slot management list.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14073
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/160312/PRTG-Network-Monitor-20.4.63.1412-Cross-Site-Scripting.html
Reference: MISC:https://gist.github.com/alert3/e058baa33c31695f4168a1dbf77103df
Reference: MISC:https://kb.paessler.com/en/topic/88223-what-s-the-open-vulnerability-report-cve-2020-14073-that-my-security-tracker-informed-me-about
Reference: MISC:https://www.paessler.com/prtg/history/stable

XSS exists in PRTG Network Monitor 20.1.56.1574 via crafted map
properties. An attacker with Read/Write privileges can create a map,
and then use the Map Designer Properties screen to insert JavaScript
code. This can be exploited against any user with View Maps or Edit
Maps access.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14074
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/kuc001/IoTFirmware/blob/master/Trendnet/TEW-827/TRENDnet-kick_ban_wifi.pdf
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/kuc001/IoTFirmware/blob/master/Trendnet/TEW-827/kick_ban_wifi_mac_allow_overflow.pdf

TRENDnet TEW-827DRU devices through 2.06B04 contain a stack-based
buffer overflow in the ssi binary. The overflow allows an
authenticated user to execute arbitrary code by POSTing to apply.cgi
via the action kick_ban_wifi_mac_allow with a sufficiently long
qcawifi.wifi0_vap0.maclist key.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14075
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/kuc001/IoTFirmware/blob/master/Trendnet/TEW-827/TRENDnet-dhcp_connect.pdf
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/kuc001/IoTFirmware/blob/master/Trendnet/TEW-827/dhcp_connect_command.pdf

TRENDnet TEW-827DRU devices through 2.06B04 contain multiple command
injections in apply.cgi via the action pppoe_connect,
ru_pppoe_connect, or dhcp_connect with the key wan_ifname (or
wan0_dns), allowing an authenticated user to run arbitrary commands on
the device.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14076
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/kuc001/IoTFirmware/blob/master/Trendnet/TEW-827/TRENDnet-st_dev.pdf

TRENDnet TEW-827DRU devices through 2.06B04 contain a stack-based
buffer overflow in the ssi binary. The overflow allows an
authenticated user to execute arbitrary code by POSTing to apply.cgi
via the action st_dev_connect, st_dev_disconnect, or st_dev_rconnect
with a sufficiently long wan_type key.

When a function is called, the memory pointer is copied to two
function modules, and an attacker can cause the pointer to be
repeatedly released through malicious operations, resulting in the
affected module crashing and affecting normal functionality, and if
successfully exploited the vulnerability can cause elevation of
privileges.

======================================================

Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://trust.mi.com/zh-CN/misrc/bulletins/advisory?cveId=17
Reference: URL:https://trust.mi.com/zh-CN/misrc/bulletins/advisory?cveId=17

interface, resulting in code execution on Xiaomi router AX3600 with
ROM version =rom< 1.1.12.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14144
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/162122/Gitea-Git-Hooks-Remote-Code-Execution.html
Reference: MISC:https://docs.github.com/en/enterprise-server@2.19/admin/policies/creating-a-pre-receive-hook-script
Reference: MISC:https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/administration/server_hooks.html
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/PandatiX/CVE-2021-28378
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/PandatiX/CVE-2021-28378#notes
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/pull/13058
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/releases
Reference: MISC:https://www.fzi.de/en/news/news/detail-en/artikel/fsa-2020-3-schwachstelle-in-gitea-1125-und-gogs-0122-ermoeglicht-ausfuehrung-von-code-nach-authent/

** DISPUTED ** The git hook feature in Gitea 1.1.0 through 1.12.5
might allow for authenticated remote code execution in customer
environments where the documentation was not understood (e.g., one
viewpoint is that the dangerousness of this feature should be
documented immediately above the ENABLE_GIT_HOOKS line in the config
file). NOTE: The vendor has indicated this is not a vulnerability and
states "This is a functionality of the software that is limited to a
very limited subset of accounts. If you give someone the privilege to
execute arbitrary code on your server, they can execute arbitrary code
on your server. We provide very clear warnings to users around this
functionality and what it provides."

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14145
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200709-0004/
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-202105-35
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202105-35
Reference: MISC:https://anongit.mindrot.org/openssh.git/commit/?id=b3855ff053f5078ec3d3c653cdaedefaa5fc362d
Reference: MISC:https://docs.ssh-mitm.at/CVE-2020-14145.html
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/openssh/openssh-portable/compare/V_8_3_P1...V_8_4_P1
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/ssh-mitm/ssh-mitm/blob/master/ssh_proxy_server/plugins/session/cve202014145.py
Reference: MISC:https://www.fzi.de/en/news/news/detail-en/artikel/fsa-2020-2-ausnutzung-eines-informationslecks-fuer-gezielte-mitm-angriffe-auf-ssh-clients/
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20201202 Some mitigation for openssh CVE-2020-14145
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2020/12/02/1

The client side in OpenSSH 5.7 through 8.4 has an Observable
Discrepancy leading to an information leak in the algorithm
negotiation. This allows man-in-the-middle attackers to target initial
connection attempts (where no host key for the server has been cached
by the client). NOTE: some reports state that 8.5 and 8.6 are also
affected.

public/pages/kumbia PATH_INFO.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14147
Status: Candidate
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-4731
Reference: URL:https://www.debian.org/security/2020/dsa-4731
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-202008-17
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202008-17
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/antirez/redis/commit/ef764dde1cca2f25d00686673d1bc89448819571
Reference: URL:https://github.com/antirez/redis/commit/ef764dde1cca2f25d00686673d1bc89448819571
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/antirez/redis/pull/6875
Reference: URL:https://github.com/antirez/redis/pull/6875
Reference: MISC:https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2021.html
Reference: URL:https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2021.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2020:1035
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-07/msg00058.html

An integer overflow in the getnum function in lua_struct.c in Redis
before 6.0.3 allows context-dependent attackers with permission to run
Lua code in a Redis session to cause a denial of service (memory
corruption and application crash) or possibly bypass intended sandbox
restrictions via a large number, which triggers a stack-based buffer
overflow. NOTE: this issue exists because of a CVE-2015-8080
regression.

Reference: MISC:https://bugs.gentoo.org/717936
Reference: MISC:https://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/info-gnu/2020-04/msg00000.html

GNU Bison before 3.5.4 allows attackers to cause a denial of service
(application crash). NOTE: there is a risk only if Bison is used with
untrusted input, and an observed bug happens to cause unsafe behavior
with a specific compiler/architecture. The bug reports were intended
to show that a crash may occur in Bison itself, not that a crash may
occur in code that is generated by Bison.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14157
Status: Candidate
Reference: FULLDISC:20200623 [SYSS_2020-014]: ABUS Secvest Wireless Control Device (FUBE50001) - Missing Encryption of Sensitive Data (CWE-311) (CVE-2020-14157)
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2020/Jun/26
Reference: MISC:http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/158204/ABUS-Secvest-Wireless-Control-Device-Missing-Encryption.html
Reference: MISC:https://www.syss.de/fileadmin/dokumente/Publikationen/Advisories/SYSS-2020-014.txt
Reference: MISC:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kCqAVYyahLc

The wireless-communication feature of the ABUS Secvest FUBE50001
device does not encrypt sensitive data such as PIN codes or IDs of
used proximity chip keys (RFID tokens). This makes it easier for an
attacker to disarm the wireless alarm system.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14158
Status: Candidate
Reference: FULLDISC:20200730 [SYSS-2020-015]: ABUS Secvest Hybrid module (FUMO50110) - Authentication Bypass Using an Alternate Path or Channel (CWE-288) (CVE-2020-14158)
Reference: URL:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2020/Jul/36
Reference: MISC:http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/158692/ABUS-Secvest-Hybrid-Module-FUMO50110-Authentication-Bypass.html
Reference: MISC:https://www.syss.de/fileadmin/dokumente/Publikationen/Advisories/SYSS-2020-015.txt

The ABUS Secvest FUMO50110 hybrid module does not have any security
mechanism that ensures confidentiality or integrity of RF packets that
are exchanged with an alarm panel. This makes it easier to conduct
wAppLoxx authentication-bypass attacks.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14159
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://www.connectwise.com/company/trust#tab1

By using an Automate API in ConnectWise Automate before 2020.5.178, a
remote authenticated user could execute commands and/or modifications
within an individual Automate instance by triggering an SQL injection
vulnerability in /LabTech/agent.aspx. This affects versions before
2019.12.337, 2020 before 2020.1.53, 2020.2 before 2020.2.85, 2020.3
before 2020.3.114, 2020.4 before 2020.4.143, and 2020.5 before
2020.5.178.

conversion in Gotenberg through 6.2.1 via the /convert/html endpoint.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14162
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://0xpanic.github.io/2020/07/21/Pihole.html
Reference: MISC:https://docs.pi-hole.net/core/pihole-command/

An issue was discovered in Pi-Hole through 5.0. The local www-data
user has sudo privileges to execute the pihole core script as root
without a password, which could allow an attacker to obtain root
access via shell metacharacters to this script's setdns command.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14163
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/jerryscript-project/jerryscript/commit/c2b662170245a16f46ce02eae68815c325d99821
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/jerryscript-project/jerryscript/issues/3804

An issue was discovered in ecma/operations/ecma-container-object.c in
JerryScript 2.2.0. Operations with key/value pairs did not consider
the case where garbage collection is triggered after the key operation
but before the value operation, as demonstrated by improper read
access to memory in ecma_gc_set_object_visited in ecma/base/ecma-gc.c.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14164
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-71184
Reference: URL:https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-71184

The WYSIWYG editor resource in Jira Server and Data Center before
version 8.8.2 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary HTML or
JavaScript names via an Cross Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability by
pasting javascript code into the editor field.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14165
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-71185
Reference: URL:https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-71185

The UniversalAvatarResource.getAvatars resource in Jira Server and
Data Center before version 8.9.0 allows remote attackers to obtain
information about custom project avatars names via an Improper
authorization vulnerability.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14166
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/162107/Atlassian-Jira-Service-Desk-4.9.1-Cross-Site-Scripting.html

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14169
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-71205
Reference: URL:https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-71205

The quick search component in Atlassian Jira Server and Data Center
before 8.9.1 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary HTML or

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-1417
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2020-1417
Reference: URL:https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2020-1417

An elevation of privilege vulnerability exists when the Windows kernel
fails to properly handle objects in memory. An attacker who
successfully exploited this vulnerability could run arbitrary code in
kernel mode. An attacker could then install programs; view, change, or
delete data; or create new accounts with full user rights. To exploit
this vulnerability, an attacker would first have to log on to the
system. An attacker could then run a specially crafted application to
take control of an affected system. The update addresses the
vulnerability by correcting how the Windows kernel handles objects in
memory.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14170
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BSERV-12433
Reference: URL:https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BSERV-12433

Webhooks in Atlassian Bitbucket Server from version 5.4.0 before
version 7.3.1 allow remote attackers to access the content of internal
network resources via a Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF)
vulnerability.

Name: CVE-2020-14172
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-70940
Reference: URL:https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-70940

This issue exists to document that a security improvement in the way
that Jira Server and Data Center use velocity templates has been
implemented. The way in which velocity templates were used in
Atlassian Jira Server and Data Center in affected versions allowed
remote attackers to achieve remote code execution via insecure
deserialization, if they were able to exploit a server side template
injection vulnerability. The affected versions are before version
7.13.0, from version 8.0.0 before 8.5.0, and from version 8.6.0 before
version 8.8.1.

Name: CVE-2020-14198
Status: Candidate
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-202009-18
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202009-18

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14199
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://blog.trezor.io/details-of-firmware-updates-for-trezor-one-version-1-9-1-and-trezor-model-t-version-2-3-1-1eba8f60f2dd

BIP-143 in the Bitcoin protocol specification mishandles the signing
of a Segwit transaction, which allows attackers to trick a user into
making two signatures in certain cases, potentially leading to a huge
transaction fee. NOTE: this affects all hardware wallets. It was fixed
in 1.9.1 for the Trezor One and 2.3.1 for the Trezor Model T.

repository configuration.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14209
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/Dolibarr/dolibarr/releases/tag/11.0.5
Reference: MISC:http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/161955/Dolibarr-ERP-CRM-11.0.4-Bypass-Code-Execution.html
Reference: MISC:https://www.wizlynxgroup.com/security-research-advisories/vuln/WLX-2020-012

Dolibarr before 11.0.5 allows low-privilege users to upload files of
dangerous types, leading to arbitrary code execution. This occurs
because .pht and .phar files can be uploaded. Also, a .htaccess file
can be uploaded to reconfigure access control (e.g., to let .noexe
files be executed as PHP code to defeat the .noexe protection
mechanism).

Name: CVE-2020-14212
Status: Candidate
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-202007-58
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202007-58
Reference: MISC:https://patchwork.ffmpeg.org/project/ffmpeg/list/?series=1463
Reference: MISC:https://trac.ffmpeg.org/ticket/8716

FFmpeg through 4.3 has a heap-based buffer overflow in avio_get_str in
libavformat/aviobuf.c because dnn_backend_native.c calls
ff_dnn_load_model_native and a certain index check is omitted.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14213
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/zammad/zammad/commit/6e56aee25439b7a3211a6704a9d60453ad623ae4
Reference: MISC:https://zammad.com/news/security-advisory-zaa-2020-13

In Zammad before 3.3.1, a Customer has ticket access that should only
be available to an Agent (e.g., read internal data, split, or merge).

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14214
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/zammad/zammad/commit/40148392426f626cb779c76d6bdda0f67bd6069d
Reference: MISC:https://zammad.com/news/security-advisory-zaa-2020-12

Zammad before 3.3.1, when Domain Based Assignment is enabled, relies
on a claimed e-mail address for authorization decisions. An attacker
can register a new account that will have access to all tickets of an
arbitrary Organization.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14215
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://blog.zulip.com/2020/06/17/zulip-server-2-1-5-security-release/

Zulip Server before 2.1.5 has Incorrect Access Control because
0198_preregistrationuser_invited_as adds the administrator role to
invitations.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14222
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://support.hcltechsw.com/csm?id=kb_article&sysparm_article=KB0084769
Reference: URL:https://support.hcltechsw.com/csm?id=kb_article&sysparm_article=KB0084769

HCL Digital Experience 8.5, 9.0, 9.5 is susceptible to cross site
scripting (XSS). One subcomponent is vulnerable to reflected XSS. In
reflected XSS, an attacker must induce a victim to click on a crafted
URL from some delivery mechanism (email, other web site).

Status: Candidate

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14224
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://support.hcltechsw.com/csm?id=kb_article&sysparm_article=KB0085913
Reference: URL:https://support.hcltechsw.com/csm?id=kb_article&sysparm_article=KB0085913

A vulnerability in the MIME message handling of the HCL Notes v9
client could potentially be exploited by an unauthenticated attacker
resulting in a stack buffer overflow. This could allow a remote
attacker to crash the Notes application or inject code into the system
which would execute with the privileges of the currently logged-in
user.

Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://support.hcltechsw.com/csm?id=kb_article&sysparm_article=KB0085915

HCL iNotes is susceptible to a Tabnabbing vulnerability caused by
improper sanitization of message content. A remote unauthenticated
attacker could use this vulnerability to trick the end user into
entering sensitive information such as credentials, e.g. as part of a
phishing attack.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14292
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://covidsafe.watch/issue-register/
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/AU-COVIDSafe/mobile-android/blob/b827cf3ccef72a3d38c6fc37466a99868823540f/app/src/main/java/au/gov/health/covidsafe/streetpass/Work.kt#L35-L41

Reference: MISC:https://www.health.gov.au/resources/apps-and-tools/covidsafe-app

In the COVIDSafe application through 1.0.21 for Android, unsafe use of
the Bluetooth transport option in the GATT connection allows attackers
to trick the application into establishing a connection over Bluetooth
BR/EDR transport, which reveals the public Bluetooth address of the
victim's phone without authorisation, bypassing the Bluetooth address
randomisation protection in the user's phone.

(obtained from the web interface).

Forgery (SSRF) flaw. With the access to add Ansible Tower provider, an
attacker could scan and attack systems from the internal network which
are not normally accessible.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14297
Status: Candidate

A flaw was discovered in Wildfly's EJB Client as shipped with Red Hat
JBoss EAP 7, where some specific EJB transaction objects may get
accumulated over the time and can cause services to slow down and
eventaully unavailable. An attacker can take advantage and cause
denial of service attack and make services unavailable.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14298
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2020:0427
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2020:0427
Reference: MISC:https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2020-14298
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2020-14298
Reference: MISC:https://access.redhat.com/security/vulnerabilities/runcescape
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/security/vulnerabilities/runcescape
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2019-5736
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2019-5736

The version of docker as released for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Extras via RHBA-2020:0053 advisory included an incorrect version of
runc missing the fix for CVE-2019-5736, which was previously fixed via
RHSA-2019:0304. This issue could allow a malicious or compromised
container to compromise the container host and other containers
running on the same host. This issue only affects docker version
1.13.1-108.git4ef4b30.el7, shipped in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Extras. Both earlier and later versions are not affected.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14299
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1848533
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1848533

A flaw was found in JBoss EAP, where the authentication configuration
is set-up using a legacy SecurityRealm, to delegate to a legacy
PicketBox SecurityDomain, and then reloaded to admin-only mode. This
flaw allows an attacker to perform a complete authentication bypass by
using an arbitrary user and password. The highest threat to
vulnerability is to system availability.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-1430
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2020-1430
Reference: URL:https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2020-1430

An elevation of privilege vulnerability exists when the Windows UPnP
Device Host improperly handles memory.To exploit this vulnerability,
an attacker would first have to gain execution on the victim system,
aka 'Windows UPnP Device Host Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability'.
This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2020-1354.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14300
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2020:0427
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2020:0427
Reference: MISC:https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2016-9962
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2016-9962
Reference: MISC:https://access.redhat.com/security/vulnerabilities/cve-2016-9962
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/security/vulnerabilities/cve-2016-9962
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2016-9962
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2016-9962

The docker packages version docker-1.13.1-108.git4ef4b30.el7 as
released for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 Extras via RHBA-2020:0053
(https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2020:0053) included an
incorrect version of runc that was missing multiple bug and security
fixes. One of the fixes regressed in that update was the fix for
CVE-2016-9962, that was previously corrected in the docker packages in
Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 Extras via RHSA-2017:0116
(https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2017:0116). The CVE-2020-14300
was assigned to this security regression and it is specific to the
docker packages produced by Red Hat. The original issue -
CVE-2016-9962 - could possibly allow a process inside container to
compromise a process entering container namespace and execute
arbitrary code outside of the container. This could lead to compromise
of the container host or other containers running on the same
container host. This issue only affects a single version of Docker,
1.13.1-108.git4ef4b30, shipped in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. Both
earlier and later versions are not affected.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14301
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210629-0007/
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1848640
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1848640

An information disclosure vulnerability was found in libvirt in
versions before 6.3.0. HTTP cookies used to access network-based disks
were saved in the XML dump of the guest domain. This flaw allows an
attacker to access potentially sensitive information in the domain
configuration via the `dumpxml` command.

Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1849584

A flaw was found in Keycloak before 13.0.0 where an external identity
provider, after successful authentication, redirects to a Keycloak
endpoint that accepts multiple invocations with the use of the same
"state" parameter. This flaw allows a malicious user to perform replay
attacks.

4.10.17, before 4.11.11 and before 4.12.4. A samba user could send an

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14304
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=960702
Reference: URL:https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=960702
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-14304
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-14304

A memory disclosure flaw was found in the Linux kernel's ethernet
drivers, in the way it read data from the EEPROM of the device. This
flaw allows a local user to read uninitialized values from the kernel
memory. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to
confidentiality.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14305
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20201210-0004/
Reference: MISC:https://bugs.openvz.org/browse/OVZ-7188
Reference: URL:https://bugs.openvz.org/browse/OVZ-7188
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1850716
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1850716
Reference: MISC:https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/project/netfilter-devel/patch/c2385b5c-309c-cc64-2e10-a0ef62897502@virtuozzo.com/
Reference: URL:https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/project/netfilter-devel/patch/c2385b5c-309c-cc64-2e10-a0ef62897502@virtuozzo.com/

An out-of-bounds memory write flaw was found in how the Linux kernel&#8217;s
Voice Over IP H.323 connection tracking functionality handled
connections on ipv6 port 1720. This flaw allows an unauthenticated
remote user to crash the system, causing a denial of service. The
highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality,
integrity, as well as system availability.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14306
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1850380
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1850380
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/maistra/istio-operator/pull/462
Reference: URL:https://github.com/maistra/istio-operator/pull/462

An incorrect access control flaw was found in the operator, openshift-
service-mesh/istio-rhel8-operator all versions through 1.1.3. This
flaw allows an attacker with a basic level of access to the cluster to
deploy a custom gateway/pod to any namespace, potentially gaining
access to privileged service account tokens. The highest threat from
this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as
system availability.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14307
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-14307
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-14307

A vulnerability was found in Wildfly's Enterprise Java Beans (EJB)
versions shipped with Red Hat JBoss EAP 7, where
SessionOpenInvocations are never removed from the remote
InvocationTracker after a response is received in the EJB Client, as
well as the server. This flaw allows an attacker to craft a denial of
service attack to make the service unavailable.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14308
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200731-0008/
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-202104-05
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202104-05
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1852009
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1852009
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20200729 multiple secure boot grub2 and linux kernel vulnerabilities
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2020/07/29/3
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20210916 Containers-optimized OS (COS) membership in the linux-distros list
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/09/17/2
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20210917 Re: Containers-optimized OS (COS) membership in the linux-distros list
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/09/17/4
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20210920 Re: Containers-optimized OS (COS) membership in the linux-distros list
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/09/21/1
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2020:1168
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-08/msg00016.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2020:1169
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-08/msg00017.html
Reference: UBUNTU:USN-4432-1
Reference: URL:https://usn.ubuntu.com/4432-1/

In grub2 versions before 2.06 the grub memory allocator doesn't check
for possible arithmetic overflows on the requested allocation size.
This leads the function to return invalid memory allocations which can
be further used to cause possible integrity, confidentiality and
availability impacts during the boot process.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14309
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200731-0008/
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-202104-05
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202104-05
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1852022
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1852022
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2020:1168
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-08/msg00016.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2020:1169
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-08/msg00017.html
Reference: UBUNTU:USN-4432-1
Reference: URL:https://usn.ubuntu.com/4432-1/

There's an issue with grub2 in all versions before 2.06 when handling
squashfs filesystems containing a symbolic link with name length of
UINT32 bytes in size. The name size leads to an arithmetic overflow
leading to a zero-size allocation further causing a heap-based buffer
overflow with attacker controlled data.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-1431
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2020-1431
Reference: URL:https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2020-1431

An elevation of privilege vulnerability exists when the Windows AppX
Deployment Extensions improperly performs privilege management,
resulting in access to system files.To exploit this vulnerability, an
authenticated attacker would need to run a specially crafted
application to elevate privileges.The security update addresses the
vulnerability by correcting how AppX Deployment Extensions manages
privileges., aka 'Windows AppX Deployment Extensions Elevation of
Privilege Vulnerability'.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14310
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-14310
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-14310
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-202104-05
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202104-05
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2020:1168
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-08/msg00016.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2020:1169
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-08/msg00017.html
Reference: UBUNTU:USN-4432-1
Reference: URL:https://usn.ubuntu.com/4432-1/

There is an issue on grub2 before version 2.06 at function
read_section_as_string(). It expects a font name to be at max
UINT32_MAX - 1 length in bytes but it doesn't verify it before proceed
with buffer allocation to read the value from the font value. An
attacker may leverage that by crafting a malicious font file which has
a name with UINT32_MAX, leading to read_section_as_string() to an
arithmetic overflow, zero-sized allocation and further heap-based
buffer overflow.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14311
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-14311
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-14311
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-202104-05
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202104-05
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20210916 Containers-optimized OS (COS) membership in the linux-distros list
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/09/17/2
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20210917 Re: Containers-optimized OS (COS) membership in the linux-distros list
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/09/17/4
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20210920 Re: Containers-optimized OS (COS) membership in the linux-distros list
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/09/21/1
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2020:1168
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-08/msg00016.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2020:1169
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-08/msg00017.html
Reference: UBUNTU:USN-4432-1
Reference: URL:https://usn.ubuntu.com/4432-1/

There is an issue with grub2 before version 2.06 while handling
symlink on ext filesystems. A filesystem containing a symbolic link
with an inode size of UINT32_MAX causes an arithmetic overflow leading
to a zero-sized memory allocation with subsequent heap-based buffer
overflow.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14312
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1851342
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1851342

A flaw was found in the default configuration of dnsmasq, as shipped
with Fedora versions prior to 31 and in all versions Red Hat
Enterprise Linux, where it listens on any interface and accepts
queries from addresses outside of its local subnet. In particular, the
option `local-service` is not enabled. Running dnsmasq in this manner
may inadvertently make it an open resolver accessible from any address
on the internet. This flaw allows an attacker to conduct a Distributed
Denial of Service (DDoS) against other systems.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14313
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1853026
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1853026

An information disclosure vulnerability was found in Red Hat Quay in
versions before 3.3.1. This flaw allows an attacker who can create a
build trigger in a repository, to disclose the names of robot accounts
and the existence of private repositories within any namespace.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14314
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-14314

Reference: UBUNTU:USN-4579-1
Reference: URL:https://usn.ubuntu.com/4579-1/

A memory out-of-bounds read flaw was found in the Linux kernel before
5.9-rc2 with the ext3/ext4 file system, in the way it accesses a
directory with broken indexing. This flaw allows a local user to crash
the system if the directory exists. The highest threat from this
vulnerability is to system availability.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14315
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1856747
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1856747
Reference: MISC:https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2020/07/09/2
Reference: URL:https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2020/07/09/2
Reference: MISC:https://www.x41-dsec.de/lab/advisories/x41-2020-006-bspatch/
Reference: URL:https://www.x41-dsec.de/lab/advisories/x41-2020-006-bspatch/

A memory corruption vulnerability is present in bspatch as shipped in
Colin Percival&#8217;s bsdiff tools version 4.3. Insufficient checks when
handling external inputs allows an attacker to bypass the sanity
checks in place and write out of a dynamically allocated buffer
boundaries.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14316
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1848951
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1848951

A flaw was found in kubevirt 0.29 and earlier. Virtual Machine
Instances (VMIs) can be used to gain access to the host's filesystem.
Successful exploitation allows an attacker to assume the privileges of
the VM process on the host system. In worst-case scenarios an attacker
can read and modify any file on the system where the VMI is running.
The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality
and integrity as well as system availability.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14317
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1854251
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1854251

It was found that the issue for security flaw CVE-2019-3805 appeared
again in a further version of JBoss Enterprise Application Platform -
Continuous Delivery (EAP-CD) introducing regression. An attacker could
exploit this by modifying the PID file in /var/run/jboss-eap/ allowing
the init.d script to terminate any process as root.

Status: Candidate

A flaw was found in the way samba handled file and directory
permissions. An authenticated user could use this flaw to gain access
to certain file and directory information which otherwise would be
unavailable to the attacker.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14319
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1854373
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1854373

It was found that the AMQ Online console is vulnerable to a Cross-Site
Request Forgery (CSRF) which is exploitable in cases where preflight
checks are not instigated or bypassed. For example authorised users
using an older browser with Adobe Flash are vulnerable when targeted
by an attacker. This flaw affects all versions of AMQ-Online prior to
1.5.2 and Enmasse versions 0.31.0-rc1 up until but not including
0.32.2.

log required extra sanitizing to prevent a reflected XSS risk.

were able to assign themselves the manager role within that course.

In Moodle before 3.9.1, 3.8.4, 3.7.7 and 3.5.13, yui_combo needed to
limit the amount of files it can load to help mitigate the risk of
denial of service.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14324
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2020-14324
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1855713
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1855713

A high severity vulnerability was found in all active versions of Red
Hat CloudForms before 5.11.7.0. The out of band OS command injection
vulnerability can be exploited by authenticated attacker while
setuping conversion host through Infrastructure Migration Solution.
This flaw allows attacker to execute arbitrary commands on CloudForms
server.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14325
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2020-14325
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1855739
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1855739

Red Hat CloudForms before 5.11.7.0 was vulnerable to the User
Impersonation authorization flaw which allows malicious attacker to
create existent and non-existent role-based access control user, with
groups and roles. With a selected group of EvmGroup-
super_administrator, an attacker can perform any API request as a
super administrator.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14326
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210713-0001/
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1855826
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1855826

A vulnerability was found in RESTEasy, where RootNode incorrectly
caches routes. This issue results in hash flooding, leading to slower
requests with higher CPU time spent searching and adding the entry.
This flaw allows an attacker to cause a denial of service.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14327
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1856785
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1856785

A Server-side request forgery (SSRF) flaw was found in Ansible Tower
in versions before 3.6.5 and before 3.7.2. Functionality on the Tower
server is abused by supplying a URL that could lead to the server
processing it. This flaw leads to the connection to internal services
or the exposure of additional internal services by abusing the test
feature of lookup credentials to forge HTTP/HTTPS requests from the
server and retrieving the results of the response.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14328
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1856786
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1856786

A flaw was found in Ansible Tower in versions before 3.7.2. A Server
Side Request Forgery flaw can be abused by supplying a URL which could
lead to the server processing it connecting to internal services or
exposing additional internal services and more particularly retrieving
full details in case of error. The highest threat from this
vulnerability is to data confidentiality.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14329
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1856787
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1856787

A data exposure flaw was found in Ansible Tower in versions before
3.7.2, where sensitive data can be exposed from the /api/v2/labels/
endpoint. This flaw allows users from other organizations in the
system to retrieve any label from the organization and also disclose
organization names. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to
confidentiality.

Information Disclosure Vulnerability'.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14330
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-14330
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-14330

Reference: MISC:https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/68400
Reference: URL:https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/68400

An Improper Output Neutralization for Logs flaw was found in Ansible
when using the uri module, where sensitive data is exposed to content
and json output. This flaw allows an attacker to access the logs or
outputs of performed tasks to read keys used in playbooks from other
users within the uri module. The highest threat from this
vulnerability is to data confidentiality.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14331
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:[debian-lts-announce] 20200928 [SECURITY] [DLA 2385-1] linux-4.19 security update
Reference: URL:https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2020/09/msg00025.html

Reference: URL:https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2020/10/msg00032.html
Reference: MISC:[debian-lts-announce] 20201031 [SECURITY] [DLA 2420-2] linux regression update
Reference: URL:https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2020/10/msg00034.html
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1858679
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1858679
Reference: MISC:https://lists.openwall.net/linux-kernel/2020/07/29/234
Reference: URL:https://lists.openwall.net/linux-kernel/2020/07/29/234
Reference: MISC:https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2020/07/28/2
Reference: URL:https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2020/07/28/2

A flaw was found in the Linux kernel&#8217;s implementation of the invert
video code on VGA consoles when a local attacker attempts to resize
the console, calling an ioctl VT_RESIZE, which causes an out-of-bounds
write to occur. This flaw allows a local user with access to the VGA
console to crash the system, potentially escalating their privileges
on the system. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data
confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14332
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-14332
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-14332

Reference: MISC:https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/71033
Reference: URL:https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/71033

A flaw was found in the Ansible Engine when using module_args. Tasks
executed with check mode (--check-mode) do not properly neutralize
sensitive data exposed in the event data. This flaw allows
unauthorized users to read this data. The highest threat from this
vulnerability is to confidentiality.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14333
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-14333
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-14333

A flaw was found in Ovirt Engine's web interface in ovirt 4.4 and
earlier, where it did not filter user-controllable parameters
completely, resulting in a reflected cross-site scripting attack. This
flaw allows an attacker to leverage a phishing attack, steal an
unsuspecting user's cookies or other confidential information, or
impersonate them within the application's context.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14334
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1858284
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1858284

A flaw was found in Red Hat Satellite 6 which allows privileged
attacker to read cache files. These cache credentials could help
attacker to gain complete control of the Satellite instance.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14335
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1858302
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1858302

A flaw was found in Red Hat Satellite, which allows a privileged
attacker to read OMAPI secrets through the ISC DHCP of Smart-Proxy.
This flaw allows an attacker to gain control of DHCP records from the
network. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system
availability.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14336
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1858981
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1858981

A flaw was found in the Restricted Security Context Constraints (SCC),
where it allows pods to craft custom network packets. This flaw allows
an attacker to cause a denial of service attack on an OpenShift
Container Platform cluster if they can deploy pods. The highest threat
from this vulnerability is to system availability.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14337
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1859139
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1859139

A data exposure flaw was found in Tower, where sensitive data was
revealed from the HTTP return error codes. This flaw allows an
unauthenticated, remote attacker to retrieve pages from the default
organization and verify existing usernames. The highest threat from
this vulnerability is to data confidentiality.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14338
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1860054
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1860054
Reference: MLIST:[xerces-j-users] 20201014 Security vulnerability in 2.12.0
Reference: URL:https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf96c5afb26b596b4b97883aa90b6c0b0fc4c26aaeea7123c21912103@%3Cj-users.xerces.apache.org%3E

A flaw was found in Wildfly's implementation of Xerces, specifically
in the way the XMLSchemaValidator class in the JAXP component of
Wildfly enforced the "use-grammar-pool-only" feature. This flaw allows
a specially-crafted XML file to manipulate the validation process in
certain cases. This issue is the same flaw as CVE-2020-14621, which
affected OpenJDK, and uses a similar code. This flaw affects all
Xerces JBoss versions before 2.12.0.SP3.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14339
Status: Candidate
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-202101-22
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202101-22
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-202210-06
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202210-06
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1860069
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1860069

A flaw was found in libvirt, where it leaked a file descriptor for
`/dev/mapper/control` into the QEMU process. This file descriptor
allows for privileged operations to happen against the device-mapper
on the host. This flaw allows a malicious guest user or process to
perform operations outside of their standard permissions, potentially
causing serious damage to the host operating system. The highest
threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality, integrity, as
well as system availability.

An elevation of privilege vulnerability exists in the way that the
Windows Sync Host Service handles objects in memory, aka 'Windows Sync
Host Service Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability'.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14340
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1860218

A vulnerability was discovered in XNIO where file descriptor leak
caused by growing amounts of NIO Selector file handles between garbage
collection cycles. It may allow the attacker to cause a denial of
service. It affects XNIO versions 3.6.0.Beta1 through 3.8.1.Final.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14341
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1860138
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1860138

The "Test Connection" available in v7.x of the Red Hat Single Sign On
application console can permit an authorized user to cause SMTP
connections to be attempted to arbitrary hosts and ports of the user's
choosing, and originating from the RHSSO installation. By observing
differences in the timings of these scans, an attacker may glean
information about hosts and ports which they do not have access to
scan directly.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14342
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-14342
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-14342
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2020-cfdd73f1b4

Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-202009-16
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202009-16
Reference: MISC:https://lists.samba.org/archive/samba-technical/2020-September/135747.html

Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2020:1579
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-09/msg00109.html

It was found that cifs-utils' mount.cifs was invoking a shell when
requesting the Samba password, which could be used to inject arbitrary
commands. An attacker able to invoke mount.cifs with special
permission, such as via sudo rules, could use this flaw to escalate
their privileges.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14343
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://github.com/SeldonIO/seldon-core/issues/2252
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/yaml/pyyaml/issues/420
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1860466
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1860466
Reference: MISC:https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuapr2022.html
Reference: URL:https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuapr2022.html
Reference: MISC:https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujul2022.html
Reference: URL:https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujul2022.html

A vulnerability was discovered in the PyYAML library in versions
before 5.4, where it is susceptible to arbitrary code execution when
it processes untrusted YAML files through the full_load method or with
the FullLoader loader. Applications that use the library to process
untrusted input may be vulnerable to this flaw. This flaw allows an
attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system by abusing the
python/object/new constructor. This flaw is due to an incomplete fix
for CVE-2020-1747.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14344
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-14344
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-14344

An integer overflow leading to a heap-buffer overflow was found in The
X Input Method (XIM) client was implemented in libX11 before version
1.6.10. As per upstream this is security relevant when setuid programs
call XIM client functions while running with elevated privileges. No
such programs are shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux.

A flaw was found in X.Org Server before xorg-x11-server 1.20.9. An
Out-Of-Bounds access in XkbSetNames function may lead to a privilege
escalation vulnerability. The highest threat from this vulnerability
is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as system
availability.

A flaw was found in xorg-x11-server before 1.20.9. An integer
underflow in the X input extension protocol decoding in the X server
may lead to arbitrary access of memory contents. The highest threat
from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as
well as system availability.

Reference: MLIST:[debian-lts-announce] 20200830 [SECURITY] [DLA 2359-1] xorg-server security update
