Reference: UBUNTU:USN-4488-1
Reference: URL:https://usn.ubuntu.com/4488-1/
Reference: UBUNTU:USN-4488-2
Reference: URL:https://usn.ubuntu.com/4488-2/

A flaw was found in the way xserver memory was not properly
initialized. This could leak parts of server memory to the X client.
In cases where Xorg server runs with elevated privileges, this could
result in possible ASLR bypass. Xorg-server before version 1.20.9 is
vulnerable.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14348
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1861814
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1861814

It was found in AMQ Online before 1.5.2 that injecting an invalid
field to a user's AddressSpace configuration of the user namespace
puts AMQ Online in an inconsistent state, where the AMQ Online
components do not operate properly, such as the failure of
provisioning and the failure of creating addresses, though this does
not impact upon already existing messaging clients or brokers.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14349
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200918-0002/
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-202008-13
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202008-13

Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-08/msg00049.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2020:1312
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-09/msg00003.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2020:1326
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-09/msg00008.html
Reference: UBUNTU:USN-4472-1
Reference: URL:https://usn.ubuntu.com/4472-1/

It was found that PostgreSQL versions before 12.4, before 11.9 and
before 10.14 did not properly sanitize the search_path during logical
replication. An authenticated attacker could use this flaw in an
attack similar to CVE-2018-1058, in order to execute arbitrary SQL
command in the context of the user used for replication.

A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that the
Windows Graphics Device Interface (GDI) handles objects in the memory,
aka 'GDI+ Remote Code Execution Vulnerability'.

Reference: UBUNTU:USN-4472-1
Reference: URL:https://usn.ubuntu.com/4472-1/

It was found that some PostgreSQL extensions did not use search_path
safely in their installation script. An attacker with sufficient
privileges could use this flaw to trick an administrator into
executing a specially crafted script, during the installation or
update of such extension. This affects PostgreSQL versions before
12.4, before 11.9, before 10.14, before 9.6.19, and before 9.5.23.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14351
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1862849
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1862849
Reference: MLIST:[debian-lts-announce] 20201210 [SECURITY] [DLA 2483-1] linux-4.19 security update

Reference: URL:https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2020/12/msg00027.html

A flaw was found in the Linux kernel. A use-after-free memory flaw was
found in the perf subsystem allowing a local attacker with permission
to monitor perf events to corrupt memory and possibly escalate
privileges. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data
confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability.

Name: CVE-2020-14352
Status: Candidate
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2020-5d9f0ce2b3
Reference: URL:https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/OOMDEQBRJ7SO2QWL7H23G3VV2VSCUYOY/

Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2020-b40fc174b5
Reference: URL:https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/XDMHVY7OMIJNSPVZ2GJWHT77Z5V3YJ55/
Reference: MISC:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-08/msg00072.html
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-08/msg00072.html
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1866498
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1866498
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2020:1428
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-09/msg00055.html

A flaw was found in librepo in versions before 1.12.1. A directory
traversal vulnerability was found where it failed to sanitize paths in
remote repository metadata. An attacker controlling a remote
repository may be able to copy files outside of the destination
directory on the targeted system via path traversal. This flaw could
potentially result in system compromise via the overwriting of
critical system files. The highest threat from this flaw is to users
that make use of untrusted third-party repositories.

CVE-2017-18270. Notes: All CVE users should reference CVE-2017-18270
instead of this candidate. All references and descriptions in this
candidate have been removed to prevent accidental usage.

Name: CVE-2020-14354
Status: Candidate
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2020-43d5a372fc
Reference: URL:https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/4OOYAMJVLLCLXDTHW3V5UXNULZBBK4O6/

A possible use-after-free and double-free in c-ares lib version 1.16.0
if ares_destroy() is called prior to ares_getaddrinfo() completing.
This flaw possibly allows an attacker to crash the service that uses
c-ares lib. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to this
service availability.

Name: CVE-2020-14355
Status: Candidate
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-4771
Reference: URL:https://www.debian.org/security/2020/dsa-4771
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1868435
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1868435

Reference: URL:https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2020/10/06/10

Reference: URL:https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2020/11/msg00001.html
Reference: MLIST:[debian-lts-announce] 20201101 [SECURITY] [DLA 2428-1] spice-gtk security update

Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2020:1802
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-11/msg00001.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2020:1803
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-11/msg00000.html
Reference: UBUNTU:USN-4572-1
Reference: URL:https://usn.ubuntu.com/4572-1/
Reference: UBUNTU:USN-4572-2
Reference: URL:https://usn.ubuntu.com/4572-2/

Multiple buffer overflow vulnerabilities were found in the QUIC image
decoding process of the SPICE remote display system, before
spice-0.14.2-1. Both the SPICE client (spice-gtk) and server are
affected by these flaws. These flaws allow a malicious client or
server to send specially crafted messages that, when processed by the
QUIC image compression algorithm, result in a process crash or
potential code execution.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14358

** REJECT ** DO NOT USE THIS CANDIDATE NUMBER. ConsultIDs: none.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14359
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1868591
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1868591
Reference: MISC:https://issues.jboss.org/browse/KEYCLOAK-14090
Reference: URL:https://issues.jboss.org/browse/KEYCLOAK-14090

A vulnerability was found in all versions of Keycloak Gatekeeper,
where on using lower case HTTP headers (via cURL) an attacker can
bypass our Gatekeeper. Lower case headers are also accepted by some
webservers (e.g. Jetty). This means there is no protection when we put
a Gatekeeper in front of a Jetty server and use lowercase headers.

A remote code execution vulnerability exists when the Windows font
library improperly handles specially crafted fonts.For all systems
except Windows 10, an attacker who successfully exploited the
vulnerability could execute code remotely, aka 'Windows Font Library
Remote Code Execution Vulnerability'.

Reference: UBUNTU:USN-4487-2
Reference: URL:https://usn.ubuntu.com/4487-2/

An integer overflow vulnerability leading to a double-free was found
in libX11. This flaw allows a local privileged attacker to cause an
application compiled with libX11 to crash, or in some cases, result in
arbitrary code execution. The highest threat from this flaw is to
confidentiality, integrity as well as system availability.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14364
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200924-0006/
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-4760
Reference: URL:https://www.debian.org/security/2020/dsa-4760
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2020-3689b67b53
Reference: URL:https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/JTZQUQ6ZBPMFMNAUQBVJFELYNMUZLL6P/
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2020-eeb29955ed
Reference: URL:https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/M52WIRMZL6TZRYZ65N6OAYNNFHV62O2N/
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-202009-14
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202009-14
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-202011-09
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202011-09
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1869201
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1869201
Reference: MISC:https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2020/08/24/2
Reference: URL:https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2020/08/24/2
Reference: MISC:https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2020/08/24/3
Reference: URL:https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2020/08/24/3
Reference: MLIST:[debian-lts-announce] 20200913 [SECURITY] [DLA 2373-1] qemu security update
Reference: URL:https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2020/09/msg00013.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2020:1664
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-10/msg00024.html
Reference: UBUNTU:USN-4511-1
Reference: URL:https://usn.ubuntu.com/4511-1/

An out-of-bounds read/write access flaw was found in the USB emulator
of the QEMU in versions before 5.2.0. This issue occurs while
processing USB packets from a guest when USBDevice 'setup_len' exceeds
its 'data_buf[4096]' in the do_token_in, do_token_out routines. This
flaw allows a guest user to crash the QEMU process, resulting in a
denial of service, or the potential execution of arbitrary code with
the privileges of the QEMU process on the host.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14365
Status: Candidate
Reference: DEBIAN:DSA-4950
Reference: URL:https://www.debian.org/security/2021/dsa-4950
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1869154
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1869154

A flaw was found in the Ansible Engine, in ansible-engine 2.8.x before
2.8.15 and ansible-engine 2.9.x before 2.9.13, when installing
packages using the dnf module. GPG signatures are ignored during
installation even when disable_gpg_check is set to False, which is the
default behavior. This flaw leads to malicious packages being
installed on the system and arbitrary code executed via package
installation scripts. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to
integrity and system availability.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14366
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-14366
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-14366

A vulnerability was found in keycloak, where path traversal using URL-
encoded path segments in the request is possible because the resources
endpoint applies a transformation of the url path to the file path.
Only few specific folder hierarchies can be exposed by this flaw

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14367
Status: Candidate
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2020-7aa962c55e
Reference: URL:https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/6WKABKNLCSC3MACCWU6OM2YGWVWFWFMU/
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-202008-23
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202008-23
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1870298
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1870298
Reference: UBUNTU:USN-4475-1
Reference: URL:https://usn.ubuntu.com/4475-1/

A flaw was found in chrony versions before 3.5.1 when creating the PID
file under the /var/run/chrony folder. The file is created during
chronyd startup while still running as the root user, and when it's
opened for writing, chronyd does not check for an existing symbolic
link with the same file name. This flaw allows an attacker with
privileged access to create a symlink with the default PID file name
pointing to any destination file in the system, resulting in data loss
and a denial of service due to the path traversal.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14368
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1823892
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1823892

A flaw was found in Eclipse Che in versions prior to 7.14.0 that
impacts CodeReady Workspaces. When configured with cookies
authentication, Theia IDE doesn't properly set the SameSite value,
allowing a Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) and consequently allowing
a cross-site WebSocket hijack on Theia IDE. This flaw allows an
attacker to gain full access to the victim's workspace through the
/services endpoint. To perform a successful attack, the attacker
conducts a Man-in-the-middle attack (MITM) and tricks the victim into
executing a request via an untrusted link, which performs the CSRF and
the Socket hijack. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to
confidentiality, integrity, as well as system availability.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14369
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1871921
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1871921

This release fixes a Cross Site Request Forgery vulnerability was
found in Red Hat CloudForms which forces end users to execute unwanted
actions on a web application in which the user is currently
authenticated. An attacker can make a forgery HTTP request to the
server by crafting custom flash file which can force the user to
perform state changing requests like provisioning VMs, running ansible
playbooks and so forth.

Name: CVE-2020-14370
Status: Candidate
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2020-3a4b8fca5e

An information disclosure vulnerability was found in containers/podman
in versions before 2.0.5. When using the deprecated Varlink API or the
Docker-compatible REST API, if multiple containers are created in a
short duration, the environment variables from the first container
will get leaked into subsequent containers. An attacker who has
control over the subsequent containers could use this flaw to gain
access to sensitive information stored in such variables.

A credential leak vulnerability was found in Red Hat Satellite. This
flaw exposes the compute resources credentials through VMs that are
running on these resources in Satellite.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14372
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210416-0004/
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2021-cab258a413
Reference: URL:https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/ZWZ36QK4IKU6MWDWNOOWKPH3WXZBHT2R/
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-202104-05
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202104-05
Reference: MISC:https://access.redhat.com/security/vulnerabilities/RHSB-2021-003
Reference: URL:https://access.redhat.com/security/vulnerabilities/RHSB-2021-003
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1873150
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1873150

A flaw was found in grub2 in versions prior to 2.06, where it
incorrectly enables the usage of the ACPI command when Secure Boot is
enabled. This flaw allows an attacker with privileged access to craft
a Secondary System Description Table (SSDT) containing code to
overwrite the Linux kernel lockdown variable content directly into
memory. The table is further loaded and executed by the kernel,
defeating its Secure Boot lockdown and allowing the attacker to load
unsigned code. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data
confidentiality and integrity, as well as system availability.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14373
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bugs.ghostscript.com/show_bug.cgi?id=702851

A use after free was found in igc_reloc_struct_ptr() of psi/igc.c of
ghostscript-9.25. A local attacker could supply a specially crafted
PDF file to cause a denial of service.

Name: CVE-2020-14374
Status: Candidate

A flaw was found in dpdk in versions before 18.11.10 and before
19.11.5. A flawed bounds checking in the copy_data function leads to a
buffer overflow allowing an attacker in a virtual machine to write
arbitrary data to any address in the vhost_crypto application. The
highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and
integrity as well as system availability.

Name: CVE-2020-14375
Status: Candidate

A flaw was found in dpdk in versions before 18.11.10 and before
19.11.5. Virtio ring descriptors, and the data they describe are in a
region of memory accessible by from both the virtual machine and the
host. An attacker in a VM can change the contents of the memory after
vhost_crypto has validated it. The highest threat from this
vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as
system availability.

Name: CVE-2020-14376

19.11.5. A lack of bounds checking when copying iv_data from the VM
guest memory into host memory can lead to a large buffer overflow. The

integrity as well as system availability.

Name: CVE-2020-14377
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1879472
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1879472
Reference: MISC:https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2020/09/28/3
Reference: URL:https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2020/09/28/3
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20210104 Re: DPDK security advisory for multiple vhost crypto issues
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/01/04/1
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20210104 Re: [dpdk-dev] DPDK security advisory for multiple vhost crypto issues
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/01/04/2
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20210104 Re: [dpdk-dev] DPDK security advisory for multiple vhost crypto issues
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/01/04/5
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2020:1593
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-10/msg00004.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2020:1599
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-10/msg00006.html
Reference: UBUNTU:USN-4550-1
Reference: URL:https://usn.ubuntu.com/4550-1/

A flaw was found in dpdk in versions before 18.11.10 and before
19.11.5. A complete lack of validation of attacker-controlled
parameters can lead to a buffer over read. The results of the over
read are then written back to the guest virtual machine memory. This
vulnerability can be used by an attacker in a virtual machine to read
significant amounts of host memory. The highest threat from this
vulnerability is to data confidentiality and system availability.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14378
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1879473
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1879473
Reference: MISC:https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2020/09/28/3
Reference: URL:https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2020/09/28/3
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20210104 Re: DPDK security advisory for multiple vhost crypto issues
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/01/04/1
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20210104 Re: [dpdk-dev] DPDK security advisory for multiple vhost crypto issues
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/01/04/2
Reference: MLIST:[oss-security] 20210104 Re: [dpdk-dev] DPDK security advisory for multiple vhost crypto issues
Reference: URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/01/04/5
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2020:1593
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-10/msg00004.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2020:1599
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-10/msg00006.html
Reference: UBUNTU:USN-4550-1
Reference: URL:https://usn.ubuntu.com/4550-1/

An integer underflow in dpdk versions before 18.11.10 and before
19.11.5 in the `move_desc` function can lead to large amounts of CPU
cycles being eaten up in a long running loop. An attacker could cause
`move_desc` to get stuck in a 4,294,967,295-count iteration loop.
Depending on how `vhost_crypto` is being used this could prevent other
VMs or network tasks from being serviced by the busy DPDK lcore for an
extended period.

======================================================

Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1840862

A flaw was found in Red Hat AMQ Broker in a way that a XEE attack can
be done via Broker's configuration files, leading to denial of service
and information disclosure.

Vulnerability'. This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2020-1373,

An account takeover flaw was found in Red Hat Satellite 6.7.2 onward.
A potential attacker with proper authentication to the relevant
external authentication source (SSO or Open ID) can claim the
privileges of already existing local users of Satellite.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14381
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1874311
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1874311
Reference: MISC:https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=8019ad13ef7f64be44d4f892af9c840179009254
Reference: URL:https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=8019ad13ef7f64be44d4f892af9c840179009254

A flaw was found in the Linux kernel&#8217;s futex implementation. This flaw
allows a local attacker to corrupt system memory or escalate their
privileges when creating a futex on a filesystem that is about to be
unmounted. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to
confidentiality, integrity, as well as system availability.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14382
Status: Candidate
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2020-5ed5af6275
Reference: URL:https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/OJTQ4KSVCW2NMSU5WFVPOHY46WMNF4OB/
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2020-8c76e12e62
Reference: URL:https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/TD6YSD63LLRRC4WQ7DJLSXWNUCY6FWBM/
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1874712
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1874712
Reference: UBUNTU:USN-4493-1
Reference: URL:https://usn.ubuntu.com/4493-1/

A vulnerability was found in upstream release cryptsetup-2.2.0 where,
there's a bug in LUKS2 format validation code, that is effectively
invoked on every device/image presenting itself as LUKS2 container.
The bug is in segments validation code in file
'lib/luks2/luks2_json_metadata.c' in function
hdr_validate_segments(struct crypt_device *cd, json_object *hdr_jobj)
where the code does not check for possible overflow on memory
allocation used for intervals array (see statement "intervals =
malloc(first_backup * sizeof(*intervals));"). Due to the bug, library
can be *tricked* to expect such allocation was successful but for far
less memory then originally expected. Later it may read data FROM
image crafted by an attacker and actually write such data BEYOND
allocated memory.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14383
Status: Candidate
Reference: GENTOO:GLSA-202012-24
Reference: URL:https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202012-24
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1892636
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1892636
Reference: MISC:https://www.samba.org/samba/security/CVE-2020-14383.html
Reference: URL:https://www.samba.org/samba/security/CVE-2020-14383.html

A flaw was found in samba's DNS server. An authenticated user could
use this flaw to the RPC server to crash. This RPC server, which also
serves protocols other than dnsserver, will be restarted after a short
delay, but it is easy for an authenticated non administrative attacker
to crash it again as soon as it returns. The Samba DNS server itself
will continue to operate, but many RPC services will not.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14384
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1875176
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1875176

A flaw was found in JBossWeb in versions before 7.5.31.Final-redhat-3.
The fix for CVE-2020-13935 was incomplete in JBossWeb, leaving it
vulnerable to a denial of service attack when sending multiple
requests with invalid payload length in a WebSocket frame. The highest
threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14385
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-14385
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-14385
Reference: MISC:https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=f4020438fab05364018c91f7e02ebdd192085933
Reference: URL:https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=f4020438fab05364018c91f7e02ebdd192085933
Reference: MLIST:[debian-lts-announce] 20200928 [SECURITY] [DLA 2385-1] linux-4.19 security update
Reference: URL:https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2020/09/msg00025.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2020:1586
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-10/msg00001.html
Reference: UBUNTU:USN-4576-1
Reference: URL:https://usn.ubuntu.com/4576-1/

A flaw was found in the Linux kernel before 5.9-rc4. A failure of the
file system metadata validator in XFS can cause an inode with a valid,
user-creatable extended attribute to be flagged as corrupt. This can
lead to the filesystem being shutdown, or otherwise rendered
inaccessible until it is remounted, leading to a denial of service.
The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14386
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-14386

A flaw was found in the Linux kernel before 5.9-rc4. Memory corruption
can be exploited to gain root privileges from unprivileged processes.
The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality
and integrity.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14387
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1875549
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1875549

A flaw was found in rsync in versions since 3.2.0pre1. Rsync
improperly validates certificate with host mismatch vulnerability. A
remote, unauthenticated attacker could exploit the flaw by performing
a man-in-the-middle attack using a valid certificate for another
hostname which could compromise confidentiality and integrity of data
transmitted using rsync-ssl. The highest threat from this
vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity. This flaw
affects rsync versions before 3.2.4.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14388
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1875553
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1875553

A flaw was found in the Red Hat 3scale API Management Platform, where
member permissions for an API's admin portal were not properly
enforced. This flaw allows an authenticated user to bypass normal
account restrictions and access API services where they do not have
permission.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14389
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1875843,
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1875843,

It was found that Keycloak before version 12.0.0 would permit a user
with only view-profile role to manage the resources in the new account
console, allowing access and modification of data the user was not
intended to have.

Services for SharePoint Server when the software fails to check the
source markup of XML file input, aka 'PerformancePoint Services Remote
Code Execution Vulnerability'.

Name: CVE-2020-14390
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1876788
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1876788

A flaw was found in the Linux kernel in versions before 5.9-rc6. When
changing screen size, an out-of-bounds memory write can occur leading
to memory corruption or a denial of service. Due to the nature of the
flaw, privilege escalation cannot be fully ruled out.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14391
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1873093
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1873093

A flaw was found in the GNOME Control Center in Red Hat Enterprise
Linux 8 versions prior to 8.2, where it improperly uses Red Hat
Customer Portal credentials when a user registers a system through the
GNOME Settings User Interface. This flaw allows a local attacker to
discover the Red Hat Customer Portal password. The highest threat from
this vulnerability is to confidentiality.

An untrusted pointer dereference flaw was found in Perl-DBI < 1.643. A
local attacker who is able to manipulate calls to dbd_db_login6_sv()
could cause memory corruption, affecting the service's availability.

Status: Candidate

Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2020:1502
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-09/msg00074.html

A buffer overflow was found in perl-DBI < 1.643 in DBI.xs. A local
attacker who is able to supply a string longer than 300 characters
could cause an out-of-bounds write, affecting the availability of the
service or integrity of data.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14394
Status: Candidate
Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2022-22b1f8dae2
Reference: URL:https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/I7J5IRXJYLELW7D43A75LOWRUE5EU54O/
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1908004
Reference: URL:https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1908004
Reference: MISC:https://gitlab.com/qemu-project/qemu/-/issues/646
Reference: URL:https://gitlab.com/qemu-project/qemu/-/issues/646
Reference: MLIST:[debian-lts-announce] 20230314 [SECURITY] [DLA 3362-1] qemu security update
Reference: URL:https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2023/03/msg00013.html

An infinite loop flaw was found in the USB xHCI controller emulation
of QEMU while computing the length of the Transfer Request Block (TRB)
Ring. This flaw allows a privileged guest user to hang the QEMU
process on the host, resulting in a denial of service.

** DISPUTED ** An issue was discovered in LibVNCServer before 0.9.13.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-1440
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2020-1440
Reference: URL:https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2020-1440

<p>A tampering vulnerability exists when Microsoft SharePoint Server
fails to properly handle profile data. An attacker who successfully
exploited this vulnerability could modify a targeted user's profile
data.</p> <p>To exploit the vulnerability, an attacker would need to
be authenticated on an affected SharePoint Server. The attacker would
then need to send a specially modified request to the server,
targeting a specific user.</p> <p>The security update addresses the
vulnerability by modifying how Microsoft SharePoint Server handles
profile data.</p>

Reference: UBUNTU:USN-4434-1
Reference: URL:https://usn.ubuntu.com/4434-1/

An issue was discovered in LibVNCServer before 0.9.13.
libvncclient/rfbproto.c does not limit TextChat size.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14408
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/agentejo/cockpit/issues/1310

An issue was discovered in Agentejo Cockpit 0.10.2. Insufficient
sanitization of the to parameter in the /auth/login route allows for
injection of arbitrary JavaScript code into a web page's content,
creating a Reflected XSS attack vector.

Name: CVE-2020-14409
Status: Candidate

(and resultant SDL_memcpy heap corruption) in SDL_BlitCopy in
video/SDL_blit_copy.c via a crafted .BMP file.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14411
Status: Candidate

** RESERVED ** This candidate has been reserved by an organization or
individual that will use it when announcing a new security problem.
When the candidate has been publicized, the details for this candidate
will be provided.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14412
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://gist.github.com/farid007/c0df57620a3cc1fb565bc77a945aa3fd

NeDi 1.9C is vulnerable to Remote Command Execution. System-
Snapshot.php improperly escapes shell metacharacters from a POST
request. An attacker can exploit this by crafting an arbitrary payload
(any system commands) that contains shell metacharacters via a POST
request with a psw parameter. (This can also be exploited via CSRF.)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14413
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://gist.github.com/farid007/8db2ab5367ba00e87f9479b32d46fea8

NeDi 1.9C is vulnerable to XSS because of an incorrect implementation
of sanitize() in inc/libmisc.php. This function attempts to escape the
SCRIPT tag from user-controllable values, but can be easily bypassed,
as demonstrated by an onerror attribute of an IMG element as a
Devices-Config.php?sta= value.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14414
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://gist.github.com/farid007/a3d96d305f028d221f729eb6ae681f5a

NeDi 1.9C is vulnerable to Remote Command Execution. pwsec.php
improperly escapes shell metacharacters from a POST request. An
attacker can exploit this by crafting an arbitrary payload (any system
commands) that contains shell metacharacters via a POST request with a
pw parameter. (This can also be exploited via CSRF.)

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14415
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://git.qemu.org/?p=qemu.git;a=commit;h=7a4ede0047a8613b0e3b72c9d351038f013dd357
Reference: UBUNTU:USN-4467-1
Reference: URL:https://usn.ubuntu.com/4467-1/

oss_write in audio/ossaudio.c in QEMU before 5.0.0 mishandles a buffer
position.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14416
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://bugzilla.suse.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1162002
Reference: MISC:https://cdn.kernel.org/pub/linux/kernel/v5.x/ChangeLog-5.4.16
Reference: MISC:https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=0ace17d56824165c7f4c68785d6b58971db954dd
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2020:0935
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-07/msg00008.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2020:1153
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-08/msg00009.html

In the Linux kernel before 5.4.16, a race condition in tty->disc_data
handling in the slip and slcan line discipline could lead to a use-
after-free, aka CID-0ace17d56824. This affects drivers/net/slip/slip.c
and drivers/net/can/slcan.c.

occurs because path redirection can occur via vectors involving

Reference: FEDORA:FEDORA-2020-efb908b6a8
Reference: URL:https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/CNHPQGSP2YM3JAUD2VAMPXTIUQTZ2M2U/

Reference: MISC:https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2021.html
Reference: URL:https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2021.html
Reference: MLIST:[debian-lts-announce] 20200715 [SECURITY] [DLA 2280-1] python3.5 security update
Reference: URL:https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2020/07/msg00011.html
Reference: MLIST:[debian-lts-announce] 20230515 [SECURITY] [DLA 3424-1] python-ipaddress security update
Reference: URL:https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2023/05/msg00016.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2020:0931
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-07/msg00003.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2020:0940
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-07/msg00006.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2020:0989
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-07/msg00032.html
Reference: SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2020:1002
Reference: URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-07/msg00041.html
Reference: UBUNTU:USN-4428-1
Reference: URL:https://usn.ubuntu.com/4428-1/

Lib/ipaddress.py in Python through 3.8.3 improperly computes hash
values in the IPv4Interface and IPv6Interface classes, which might
allow a remote attacker to cause a denial of service if an application
is affected by the performance of a dictionary containing
IPv4Interface or IPv6Interface objects, and this attacker can cause
many dictionary entries to be created. This is fixed in: v3.5.10,
v3.5.10rc1; v3.6.12; v3.7.9; v3.8.4, v3.8.4rc1, v3.8.5, v3.8.6,
v3.8.6rc1; v3.9.0, v3.9.0b4, v3.9.0b5, v3.9.0rc1, v3.9.0rc2.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14423
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://convos.chat/blog/2020/6/18/local-secret-got-more-secure
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/Nordaaker/convos/commit/54d1763ac65c05aad27ad454b4e5a62ba8352d39
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/Nordaaker/convos/compare/4.19...4.20

Convos before 4.20 does not properly generate a random secret in
Core/Settings.pm and Util.pm. This leads to a predictable
CONVOS_LOCAL_SECRET value, affecting password resets and invitations.

unauthenticated attacker. This affects RBK752 before 3.2.15.25, RBK753

RBS750 before 3.2.15.25, RBK852 before 3.2.15.25, RBK853 before
3.2.15.25, RBR850 before 3.2.15.25, RBS850 before 3.2.15.25, RBK842
before 3.2.15.25, RBR840 before 3.2.15.25, and RBS840 before
3.2.15.25.

Name: CVE-2020-14473
Status: Candidate
Reference: CONFIRM:https://www.draytek.com/about/security-advisory/vigor3900-/-vigor2960-/-vigor300b-stack-based-buffer-overflow-vulnerability-(cve-2020-14473)

Stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability in Vigor3900, Vigor2960, and
Vigor300B with firmware before 1.5.1.1.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14474
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/158254/Cellebrite-EPR-Decryption-Hardcoded-AES-Key-Material.html
Reference: MISC:http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2020/Jun/31
Reference: MISC:https://korelogic.com/Resources/Advisories/KL-001-2020-003.txt

The Cellebrite UFED physical device 5.0 through 7.5.0.845 relies on
key material hardcoded within both the executable code supporting the
decryption process, and within the encrypted files themselves by using
a key enveloping technique. The recovered key material is the same for
every device running the same version of the software, and does not
appear to be changed with each new build. It is possible to
reconstruct the decryption process using the hardcoded key material
and obtain easy access to otherwise protected data.

======================================================
Name: CVE-2020-14475
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://github.com/Dolibarr/dolibarr/commit/22ca5e067189bffe8066df26df923a386f044c08

A reflected cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Dolibarr
11.0.3 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML
into public/notice.php (related to transphrase and transkey).

Name: CVE-2020-14478
Status: Candidate
Reference: MISC:https://www.cisa.gov/uscert/ics/advisories/icsa-20-177-02
Reference: URL:https://www.cisa.gov/uscert/ics/advisories/icsa-20-177-02

A local, authenticated attacker could use an XML External Entity (XXE)
attack to exploit weakly configured XML files to access local or
remote content. A successful exploit could potentially cause a denial-
of-service condition and allow the attacker to arbitrarily read any
local file via system-level services.
